1.name: Paid Lunacy
1.desc: A rose-shaped crystalline material. Used for performing extractions and purchasing Enkephalin boxes.
1.flavor: A crystal rose that seems to be facing a certain direction at all times. This humanlike object is said to absorb the moisture from a certain river to bloom.

2.name: Free Lunacy
2.desc: A rose-shaped crystalline material. Used for performing extractions and purchasing Enkephalin boxes.
2.flavor: A crystal rose that seems to be facing a certain direction at all times. This humanlike object is said to absorb the moisture from a certain river to bloom.

3.name: Lunacy
3.desc: A rose-shaped crystalline material. Used for performing extractions and purchasing Enkephalin boxes.
3.flavor: Embracing the madness is a necessary step for humans to move forward.

11.name: Enkephalin Module
11.flavor:
A spherical module designed for special containment.
[NOTE] Utilizing a dosage of liquid Enkephalin allows for more stable usage compared to its gaseous form.
The Enkephalin can be converted into energy by plugging the module into a designated socket.
[CAUTION] Modularization of Enkephalin is an irreversible process; the module may only be expended via a socket.
Usage outside of intended purposes or modification is strictly forbidden.

101.name: Extraction Ticket
101.desc: Can be used to perform 1 extraction.
101.flavor:
A consumable item weaved from Lunacy, the source of Mephistopheles’ extractive energy.
It looks like a thin sheet of paper at a glance, but something seems to be pulsating inside.

102.name: Decaextraction Ticket
102.desc: Can be used to perform 10 extractions.
102.flavor:
A consumable item weaved from Lunacy, the source of Mephistopheles’ extractive energy.
It looks like a thin sheet of paper at a glance, but something seems to be pulsating inside.

103.name: 3★ Guarantee Decaextraction Ticket
103.desc: Can be used to perform 10 extractions where one 3★ Identity is guaranteed to appear.
103.flavor: A special ticket with a mark on it. It can extract an Identity from a world of unlikely possibilities with certainty. The paper is fiercely beating and pulsing.

104.name: [Season 1] 3★ Guarantee Decaextraction Ticket
104.desc: Can be used to perform 10 extractions where one 3★ Identity from [Season 1] is guaranteed to appear.
104.flavor: A special ticket with a mark on it. It can extract an Identity from a world of unlikely possibilities with certainty. The paper is fiercely beating and pulsing.

105.name: [Season 2] 3★ Guarantee Decaextraction Ticket
105.desc: Can be used to perform 10 extractions where one 3★ Identity from [Season 2] is guaranteed to appear.
105.flavor: A special ticket with a mark on it. It can extract an Identity from a world of unlikely possibilities with certainty. The paper is fiercely beating and pulsing.

106.name: [Season 3] 3★ Guarantee Decaextraction Ticket
106.desc: Can be used to perform 10 extractions where one 3★ Identity from [Season 3] is guaranteed to appear.
106.flavor: A special ticket with a mark on it. It can extract an Identity from a world of unlikely possibilities with certainty. The paper is fiercely beating and pulsing.

201.name: Thread
201.desc: Used for the Uptying of Identities and Threadspinning of E.G.O.
201.flavor:
Thread is a string-like object conceived to tie all possibilities into one place.
Our company is utilizing Thread in various ways, such as Uptying Identities or Threadspinning E.G.O to better understand it.

211.name: Identity Training Ticket I
211.flavor:
A ticket bearing possibilities of the past, present, and future.
“I found that a thought of something I’d never experienced planted itself firmly in my head.”

212.name: Identity Training Ticket II
212.flavor:
A ticket bearing possibilities of the past, present, and future.
“Hmhm~ I’ve never been to the southern quarter before, so why does it feel so familiar…?”

213.name: Identity Training Ticket III
213.flavor:
A ticket bearing possibilities of the past, present, and future.
“…If I could have had such a convenient thing in the past, those nightmarish plights would’ve been so simple to overcome.”

214.name: Identity Training Ticket IV
214.flavor:
A Ticket shimmering with possibilities we experienced, are experiencing, and will experience.
"This is a feeling not unlike getting memories we did not experience forced into us. This is not the most pleasant feeling, but it is certainly efficient.

221.name: Level Boost Ticket I
221.desc: Raises an Identity’s level to up to 10.
221.flavor:
A limit-disengaging ticket that allows an Identity to hold excess experience.
“Oho! Mine frame hath become more apt than ever to enact justice!”

222.name: Level Boost Ticket II
222.desc: Raises an Identity’s level to up to 20.
222.flavor:
A limit-disengaging ticket that allows an Identity to hold excess experience.
“It’s… strangely calming. I feel like I can do things I couldn’t before.”

223.name: Level Boost Ticket III
223.desc: Raises an Identity’s level to up to 30.
223.flavor:
A limit-disengaging ticket that allows an Identity to hold excess experience.
“This thing would’ve been a real menace if it was available during wartime. Imagine fostering veterans in mere seconds.”

224.name: Level Boost Ticket IV
224.desc: Raises an Identity’s level to up to 40.
224.flavor:
A limit-disengaging ticket that allows an Identity to hold excess experience. 
"O.P. To give me years of experience in using a technique I've never used before...  there is no satisfaction here. Revolting."

231.name: Identity Takeoff Ticket
231.desc: Raises an Identity’s level to up to 40, and Uptie Tier up to Tier 4.
231.flavor:
Tear this ticket to activate it.
It tears through the space-time, uptying and enhancing an Identity at a ridiculous speed.
It makes a pretty addicting sound when it tears; makes one want to tear more tickets.

301.name: Enkephalin Box
301.flavor:
A stable container storing liquid Enkephalin.
[CAUTION] Handling this box without following the prescribed procedures may result in accidents such as Enkephalin leakage.
Unregulated ingestion of Enkephalin may cause a wide range of unverified psychopathological symptoms.

401.name: Thread Crate
401.desc: Open to receive 1-3 strands of Thread.
401.flavor:
A crate of bundled possibilities.
No one knows how much you can draw from it.

1101.name: [Season 1] Egoshard Crate
1101.desc: Open to receive 1-3 Egoshards of random Sinners.
1101.flavor:
Egoshards were randomly harvested and stored in these boxes. Its contents are a mystery.
When you hold one in a quiet place, you can hear small fusses.

1201.name: [Season 1] Nominable Egoshard Crate
1201.desc: Open to receive 1-3 Egoshards of a Sinner of choice.
1201.flavor:
A crate that yields Egoshards of a Sinner you choose.
According to Faust, its contents are determined once a manager makes their decision.

1102.name: [Season 2] Egoshard Crate
1102.desc: Open to receive 1-3 Egoshards of random Sinners.
1102.flavor:
Egoshards were randomly harvested and stored in these boxes. Its contents are a mystery.
When you hold one in a quiet place, you can hear small fusses.

1202.name: [Season 2] Nominable Egoshard Crate
1202.desc: Open to receive 1-3 Egoshards of a Sinner of choice.
1202.flavor:
A crate that yields Egoshards of a Sinner you choose.
According to Faust, its contents are determined once a manager makes their decision.

1103.name: [Season 3] Egoshard Crate
1103.flavor:
Egoshards were randomly harvested and stored in these boxes. Its contents are a mystery.
When you hold one in a quiet place, you can hear small fusses.

1203.name: [Season 3] Nominable Egoshard Crate
1203.desc: Open to receive 1-3 Egoshards of a Sinner of choice.
1203.flavor:
A crate that yields Egoshards of a Sinner you choose.
According to Faust, its contents are determined once a manager makes their decision.

10101.name: [Season 1] Yi Sang’s Egoshard
10101.desc: Used for purchasing Yi Sang’s Identities, E.G.O, and Thread from the Dispenser.
10101.flavor:
Fleeting moments from any point within the Sinner’s lifetime, condensed into physical form. The shards float in the air.
Possibilities are transient things; they drift in the realm of uncertainty unless seized.

10201.name: [Season 1] Faust’s Egoshard
10201.desc: Used for purchasing Faust’s Identities, E.G.O, and Thread from the Dispenser.

10002.name: Season 2 [Selected Sinner]’s Egoshard
10002.desc: 재화 등장 확률 상세 표시용(name 만 번역해주세요)

20001.name: Bus-modifying Scrap
20001.desc:
Miscellaneous junk like rusted plates and bolts ripped from the backs of trash crabs.
Could be used for modifying Mephistopheles.

20002.name: Rare Horseshoe with Bus-modifying Scrap
20002.desc:
A large horseshoe-shaped item taken from the king trash crab.
It could substitute several pieces of scrap, or so we're told.

20009.name: Trinkets Sack
20009.desc:
A sack full of trinkets and decorations hastily taken from the Gift Factory.
Don Quixote will make good use of these to spruce up the Mephistopheles' interiors.

20010.name: Huge Trinkets Sack
20010.desc:
A huge sack filled to the brim with trinkets and decorations from the Gift Factory.
Don Quixote will make good use of these to spruce up the Mephistopheles' interiors.

20012.name: Bloodied Scabbard
20012.desc:
Those who wield blades in life leave behind bloodied scabbards in death.
The true abode of those who walk the path of blades is their scabbard.

20013.name: Resentful Scabbard
20013.desc:
One who wields their blade with deep resentment is called a Demon of the Blade.
Demon of the Blade no longer has need of a scabbard; yet they carry it, as that resentment is tinged with a lingering attachment.

20017.name: Pocket Watch
20017.desc:
Everyone has their own timepiece, with varying time scales.
Time that goes by quickly. Time that lingers.
The hours are always misaligned.

20018.name: Pocket Watch Bundle
20018.desc:
The same destination awaits every timepiece.
The hours finally align when the hands stop ticking down the seconds, when one breathes their final lungful of air.

20020.name: Civilian Recov. Pack
20020.desc:
Used to purchase various rewards from the Reward Exchange menu.

<color=#a16a3b>Notice to Cleanup Agents: please collect and store a single passenger's parts in this pack. No matter how difficult it may appear to collect their parts, do note that there is a single strand of vein connecting the passenger's parts together. Imagine you are spinning a yarn ball into shape, and patiently collect them one by one.</color>

20021.name: Fixer Recov. Pack
20021.desc:
Spawns rarely. Converted to 20 Civilian Recov. Pack immediately upon acquisition.

<color=#a16a3b>On occasion, you may have to work on passengers equipped with prosthetics.
Please note that even full-body prosthetics do not remove the passenger's brain.
Any prosthetic parts recognized by the brain as the passenger's own body will be connected by veins, so there is no need to worry about mix-and-matching them together.
Remember: blood is thicker than water.</color>

232.name: Takeoff Module - ID Uptie
232.desc: Raises an Identity’s Uptie Tier up to Tier 4.
232.flavor:
Rapid Identity Uptie Module developed by LCA R&D Team.
Forcibly insert the shimmering threads and weave the shards together, rapidly raising the Uptie tier to a certain level.
While those outside the mirror may not know, this devastating injection sweeps short-lived destruction through the mirror.

233.name: Takeoff Module - E.G.O Spinning [WAW] x1
233.desc: Raises an E.G.O's Threadspinning Tier up to Tier 4. (Usable only on E.G.Os WAW Level or lower)
233.flavor:
E.G.O Threadspinning Module developed by LCA R&D Team.
Weaves the shimmering threads with numerous shards, enhancing the E.G.O Threadspinning tier to a certain level at an accelerated pace.
It is yet to be known how much more of this pressure the heart known as E.G.O... can handle Threadspinning these Abnormal-Psychoment based E.G.Os so carelessly out of convenience.

501.name: Nominable S1 Identity Ticket
501.desc: Use this item to select a Season 1 Identity(including Event Identities) to obtain.
501.flavor:
A ticket capable of observing and pulling out an Identity of a particular period within the LCB team's pursuit of Golden Boughs.
'The ability to target and pull up a specific period in which an Identity from an observed Mirror World demonstrates Limbus Company's vastly significant technological triumph. - LCA Mirror World Observatorium Department Mirror Researcher'

601.name: Nominable S1 Battle Pass E.G.O Ticket
601.desc: Use this item to select a Season 1 Battle Pass E.G.O to obtain.
601.flavor:
A ticket capable of observing and pulling out an E.G.O of a particular period within the LCB team's pursuit of Golden Boughs.
'Dragging up an E.G.O, observed within a specific period from the deep fathoms, is a much more complicated research than making Identities selectable. Fuhu. - LCA Mirror World Observatorium Department Observation Researcher'

12004.name: Season 4 Uptie & Threadspinning only Shard (Universal)
12004.desc: Can be used to Uptie Identities and Threadspin E.G.O for all Sinners.
12004.flavor:
A universal shard that can be used to Uptie or Threadspin Identities & E.G.O for all Sinners.
However, these shards cannot be used to extract Identities or E.G.O, no matter how many of these shards one collects.
'These shards are products of our research into the omnitransformative nature of Golden Boughs; it can be used to fill any fathoms or worlds of mirrors. Huh? Extractions? Of course not. Its one-size-fits-all-worlds nature would mean that it obviously cannot have been made *for* any specific world, right? - LCA Mirror World Observatorium Department Chief Researcher'

107.name: [Season 4] 3★ Guarantee Decaextraction Ticket
107.desc: Can be used to perform 10 extractions where one 3★ Identity from [Season 4] is guaranteed to appear.
107.flavor: A special ticket with a mark on it. It can extract an Identity from a world of unlikely possibilities with certainty. The paper is fiercely beating and pulsing.

1104.name: [Season 4] Egoshard Crate
1104.flavor:
Egoshards were randomly harvested and stored in these boxes. Its contents are a mystery.
When you hold one in a quiet place, you can hear small fusses.

1204.flavor:

10304.flavor:
Fleeting moments from any point within the Sinner’s lifetime, condensed into physical form. The shards float in the air.
Possibilities are transient things; they drift in the realm of uncertainty unless seized.

10004.name: Season 4 [Selected Sinner]’s Egoshard
10004.desc: 재화 등장 확률 상세 표시용(name 만 번역해주세요)

108.name: [Season 5] 3★ Guarantee Decaextraction Ticket
108.desc: Can be used to perform 10 extractions where one 3★ Identity from [Season 5] is guaranteed to appear.
108.flavor: A special ticket with a mark on it. It can extract an Identity from a world of unlikely possibilities with certainty. The paper is fiercely beating and pulsing.

225.name: Level Boost Ticket V
225.desc: Raises an Identity’s level to up to 50.
225.flavor:
A limit-disengaging ticket that allows an Identity to hold excess experience.
"Verbally incommunicable amount of knowledge and information deluges into my brain in such merciless brutality that the suggestion that one should acclimatize oneself to it is, despite having prior engagement with such a method, a rather ludicrous idea. The side effects of this procedure included vomiting, nausea, and rupturing of blood vessels within the ocular region, causing redness in vision. However, it can be said with certainty that we have been made stronger as a result."

1105.name: [Season 5] Egoshard Crate
1105.desc: Contains 1-3 Egoshards of a random Sinner.
1105.flavor:
Egoshards were randomly harvested and stored in these boxes. Its contents are a mystery.
When you hold one in a quiet place, you can hear small fusses.

1205.name: [Season 5] Nominable Egoshard Crate
1205.desc: Open to receive 1-3 Egoshards of a Sinner of choice.
1205.flavor:
A crate that yields Egoshards of a Sinner you choose.
According to Faust, the crate's content is determined once the manager makes their decision.

12005.name: Season 5 Uptie & Threadspinning only Shard (Universal)
12005.desc: Can be used to Uptie Identities and Threadspin E.G.O for all Sinners.
12005.flavor:
A universal shard that can be used to Uptie or Threadspin Identities & E.G.O for all Sinners.
However, these shards cannot be used to extract Identities or E.G.O, no matter how many of these shards one collects.
'These shards are products of our research into the omnitransformative nature of Golden Boughs; it can be used to fill any fathoms or worlds of mirrors. Huh? Extractions? Of course not. Its one-size-fits-all-worlds nature would mean that it obviously cannot have been made *for* any specific world, right? - LCA Mirror World Observatorium Department Chief Researcher'

10005.name: Season 5 [Selected Sinner]’s Egoshard
10005.desc: 재화 등장 확률 상세 표시용(name 만 번역해주세요)
